intro: Achmandra rostrata, commonly known as the rostrate achmandra, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, clustered in small inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests.
